Name: Alaska (PSX 2673)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, about 70 days early, football shaped fruit 6-9', light salmon colored flesh, netted, larger fruit than Mainrock.

Name: Alienor
Characteristics: charentais type slightly netted to netted, monoecious with excellent eating quality and very good shelf life; vigorous plant with good foliage development spherical to oblong fruit, green gray skin, well ribbed, excellent uniformity of size, average weight 700-900g.

Name: All Star (HXP 3587)
Characteristics: shipping melon adapted to southern and eastern environments, high yields, disease resistance, good melon quality and good fruit size.

Name: Alwaha (FMX 44)
Characteristics: a more completely netted Ananas type with large size, yellow-orange color, excellent taste and aroma; vigorous vines with good cover.

Name: Ambrosia
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, densely netted, extremely thick flesh with small seed cavity; sweet, firm, juicy flesh of light salmon color.

Name: Anasta (XPH 6115)
Characteristics: fruit oval-round, weigh 1.5 kg, rind slightly netted, flesh greenish yellow when mature.
Resistance: powdery mildew and fusarium wilt races 0, 1, 2.

Name: Apollo (RML 5292)
Characteristics: cantaloupe; large fruit with good internal quality and excellent flavor.
Resistance: fusarium wilt race 0, 1, 2; powdery mildew race 1, 2.

Name: Aquila (XPH 6244)
Characteristics: round western shipper that produces a very pronounced net under extreme heat stress conditions.

Name: Aragon (XPH 5094)
Characteristics: a western shipper type, round sutureless, small seed cavity, even close net, makes size under stress conditions.

Name: Argonaut (NVH 886)
Characteristics: slight oval melon with a heavy net covering sutures; dark orange flesh.

Name: Arizona 13
Characteristics: smaller, sweeter, better appearing fruit, vigorous vines, good coverage, prolific.
Adaptation: southwestern United States. Southern Seedsman, November, 1943.

Name: Arizona Sunrise
Characteristics: 10 days earlier than PMR 45, concentration of early yield, prolific, fruit more spherical, better net, better sutures, higher sugar.
Adaptation: southwestern United States. Progressive Agr. VI (4), 1955.
Parentage: Hale's Best 936 x ((PMR 45 x Jap) x AZ).

Name: Aurora (AC 68-52)
Characteristics: large fruit, high quality, orange flesh color.
Resistance: gummy stem blight, downy mildew, powdery mildew.

Name: Azuero Gold (XP 6109)
Characteristics: Canary type melon, excellent quality, medium, to large fruit, bright yellow in color.

Name: Baby Slip
Breeder: Hollar and Company, Rocky Ford, Colorado.
Characteristics: matures full slip stem in about 85 days; size small, 5.5-6', weight 2.5-3.5 pounds, holds well when picked fully ripe, green fleshed, very sweet.

Name: Barada (XP 917)
Characteristics: open pollinated, early maturity and uniformity.

Name: Big Daddy
Characteristics: large, vigorous plants; fruit have a medium net with thick pale orange flesh, fruit avg. 6-8 lb. and are basically round.

Name: Brilliance
Characteristics: honeydew; large fruit; good shipping quality.

Name: Buccaneer (NVH 877)
Characteristics: fruit are slightly oval, 6-6.5', moderate sutures, fine netting covers the fruit, thick flesh is bright orange, matures in about 76 days, home garden, truck farm type.

Name: Burpee Early Crenshaw
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, typical thick flesh of Crenshaw melon, but early enough to be grown in most parts of the United States.

Name: Burpee Hybrid
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, early, medium large fruit, heavy net, medium deep ribs; high quality, thick, orange flesh.

Name: Bush Whopper (PSR 575)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, small compact dwarf bush, medium size cavity, deep orange flesh color.

Name: Cabrillo (XP 3910848)
Characteristics: large, round, firm fruit, high Brix, small seed cavity, good flesh color, strong plant with good yield and uniformity.

Name: Camelot (XPH 5099)
Characteristics: large fruited, heavily ribbed and netted, early with high sugar content.

Name: Cameo (Expt. Hyb. 3027)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, very early, large fruit and vine; fruit have smooth white exterior and soft pale green flesh; very high sugar.

Name: Carnival (SME 8501)
Characteristics: crenshaw with sweeter flesh.

Name: Caroline (SSC 110)
Characteristics: honeydew type; very prolific, early season honeydew melon; uniform production of smooth, round fruit in the 4, 5 and 6 size range; firm fruit with a small blossom scar and small to medium seed cavity; light green flesh with high sugars.

Name: Casablanca (PSX 001155)
Characteristics: soft textured, white flesh with faint orange around seed cavity, oval shape, dark green rind turning yellowish at maturity; high sugar content; midseason maturity.

Name: Cassandra (SSC 118)
Characteristics: hybrid honeydew melon with strong vines and good fruit set; produces smooth, oval-round fruit with a small to medium seed cavity; fruit sizes are 4's, 5's and 6's; sweet, pale green flesh; relative maturity is 85-90 days.

Name: Castella (Nun 7949)
Characteristics: long shelf life, early maturity, fruit wt. 1.5-1.6 kg, netted and sutured, orange flesh, very sweet.

Name: Castillo (BOS 3001)
Characteristics: strong vine with good cover; fruit are round, full-netted, and mature uniformly.

Name: Chaca No. 1
Characteristics: hybrid, round oval shape, open netting, gold rind, distinct melon flavor.

Name: Challenger (NVH 882)
Characteristics: sutureless round oval fruit, well netted, firm flesh, small cavity, mid-season maturity, shipper type.
Resistance: powdery mildew races 1, 2; some downy mildew.

Name: Chando (XP 762)
Characteristics: not the same as Chando XP 9042; F1 hybrid, small size Charantais melon with distinct flavor.
Resistance: fusarium wilt and one or more races of powdery mildew.

Name: Chando (XPH 9042)
Characteristics: not the same as Chando XP 762; early maturity, Galia type, high sugar content, fruit 3 lb wt.; green flesh, yellow sparsely netted exterior.

Name: Chieftain (75-3042)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, thick, firm, orange flesh of high quality; very small seed cavity; resistant to internal flesh breakdown and bitterness; thin rind with moderate netting and shallow suture.
Resistance: powdery mildew (race 1), downy mildew, fusarium wilt.

Name: Clipper
Characteristics: long shelf life, medium early, orange flesh, fruit weight 0.8-1.0 kg, high sugar.

Name: Columbia (NVH 876)
Characteristics: slightly oval fruit, 5-5.5', moderate sutures, well netted; medium orange thick flesh, very good flavor, maturity about 76 days, home garden truck farm type.

Name: Concorde (XPH 921)
Characteristics: high yield uniform fruit.

Name: Conqueror (NVH 875)
Characteristics: slightly oval fruit, 5.5 x 6', fine netting and slight suture, medium orange thick flesh, normal vine, 76 day maturity, home garden truck farm type.

Name: Conquistador (GSV 83-92)
Characteristics: early maturing, fruit are oval, deep sutured, coarse netted; fruit 3.5 to 4 lb wt., sweet firm, orange closed flesh.

Name: Cordele (XPH 5361)
Characteristics: named Cameo in Europe; early, sutured, eastern U.S. type muskmelon weighing up to 7 lb, slightly elongated; fine flavor, deep orange color.

Name: Cortez (XPH 5098)
Characteristics: early maturity, large fruited, sutured melon, pink flesh, with a small core; for areas where earliness and 4 lb+ size is needed.

Name: Coup d' Orange (23324)
Characteristics: orange flesh honeydew, strong plant, uniform fruit size, firm and sweet flesh, medium to large fruit.

Name: Creme de Menthe (Sunex 7049)
Characteristics: very productive honeydew, tremendously vigorous plant.

Name: Cristobal (XPH 6005)
Characteristics: like Mission in fruit size, shape and netting with robust vine. Full netted, non sutured western shipper.

Name: Dainiel (NUN 8961)
Characteristics: Piel de Sapo type, high sugar content, fruit weight 2.0-3.5 kg, greenish white flesh.

Name: Daybreak (HMX 8580)
Characteristics: large sized, early maturity, very uniform round shape, green flesh.
Resistance: fusarium wilt races 0, 2 and powdery mildew.

Name: De Conick Bender
Breeder: grown and selected by a number of muskmelon growers in Greece, New York.
Vendor: Joseph Harris Company, Rochester, New York.
Characteristics: large, coarse, well netted, ribbed fruit; midseason maturity; vigorous vine; yellow flesh.

Name: Debonaire (XPH 6119)
Characteristics: very early, large muskmelon with fine netting and sutures.

Name: Delada (Nun 8984)
Characteristics: very uniform, round, netted, average fruit weight 0.9-1.1 kg.

Name: Delicious 51
Breeder: H.M. Munger, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York.
Characteristics: fruit round or slightly oval, well netted, moderately ribbed; flesh thick, golden, crisp, juicy; large size and sweet flavor of original Delicious, can be grown in infected soil; difficult to distinguish from Delicious (Joseph Harris. strain) except for disease resistance.

Name: Deltex (Num 6275)
Characteristics: round, oval, netted fruit, white flesh, vigorous growth, average fruit weight 1.3-1.4 kg, nonsutured.

Name: Dessert Sun
Characteristics: prolific; dark foliage; earlier than Hale's Best 45.
Resistance: powdery mildew, tolerance to crown blight.

Name: Destacado (PS 03902039)
Characteristics: main season Honeydew type with very strong and vigorous plant and excellent fruit set; fruit are round in shape, large in size (2-2.5 kg), with good internal quality, medium to small seed cavity, firm flesh; high yield; develops an external color change from cream to light yellow at maturity.

Name: Dewlicious (PS 8893)
Characteristics: yellow rind honeydew for specialty market; large fruit size, green to white flesh, very sweet, good texture.

Name: Dixie Jumbo (PSR 7574)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, large, 6.5 x 7.5', early, long, oval shaped fruit, sutured exterior with heavy netting, yellow-green interior color, salmon-orange flesh.

Name: Don Carlos (XPH 6245)
Characteristics: like Mission, but slightly larger fruit, robust vine.

Name: Don Domingo (XPH 6110)
Characteristics: large, main season western shipper.

Name: Don Juan (XP 761)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, early maturity, netted medium fruit.
Resistance: fusarium wilt and one or more races of powdery mildew.

Name: Dorado (PSX 1087)
Characteristics: excellent quality fruit, early maturity, large size.

Name: Dro Dulce (XPH 6078)
Characteristics: like Honey in size and shape, but skin flesh is cream colored with relatively small seed.

Name: Duro
Characteristics: large fruited, shipper hybrid; a full net melon with no sutures.

Name: Earlibrew
Characteristics: outstanding, early maturing, honeydew green flesh type with excellent size.

Name: Earlidew (PSX 1876)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, early maturing Honey Dew type with smooth skin and no sutures; exterior color green to green-gold at maturity; fruit round, 5-6', with lime-green flesh.

Name: Earligold F1 (EX-29-6A)
Characteristics: 5 days earlier than Goldstar, jumbo type melon. 1985.

Name: Earlimark F1 (SS 127)
Characteristics: tolerant to sulfur.

Name: Earlisweet
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, extremely early, round fruit with medium netting and slight ribbing.

Name: Early Crisp (001,319)
Characteristics: honeydew type with vigorous plant, good cover, round fruit, slightly oblate, good size, early maturity, firm flesh.

Name: Early Dawn (G2P)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, extra early, round to oval monoecious hybrid.
Resistance: tolerance to fusarium wilt and powdery mildew.

Name: Early Delight (PS 39094)
Characteristics: early maturing cantaloupe; strong vine; large size fruit; improved quality, netting and sugar content over Primo.

Name: Early Eastern Shipper (H-22545)
Characteristics: early PMR 45 type with muskmelon flavor.

Name: Early Sugarshaw
Characteristics: early maturity, about 85 days, 8-9 lb melons similar to open pollinated Crenshaw melons, orange flesh; green rind, no net, no sutures, turns yellowish.

Name: Eastern Star
Characteristics: large size, early mid-season maturity, thick flesh of high quality, distinct ribs. 1987.

Name: Eclipse (PSX 103292)
Resistance: powdery mildew race 1, fusarium wilt race 2.

Name: Edisto
Characteristics: hard rind, firm, thick flesh; one week later than Jumbo Hale's.
Adaptation: southeastern United States, possibly Kansas and Iowa. South Carolina. Agr. Res. 3:4. October 1956.
Resistance: high to alternaria , moderate to downy mildew , and powdery mildew.

Name: Edisto 47 (SC 180)
Characteristics: fruit large, 3-5 pounds, 3-7 days later than Edisto; vine vigorous.
Adaptation: southeastern and lower Atlantic coastal regions. South Carolina. Sta. Annu. Rpt. 1962-1963. 1965.
Resistance: downy mildew, powdery mildew, and alternaria.
Parentage: F8 of cross of a sister line of Edisto with Georgia 47.

Name: Emerald
Characteristics: smooth rind.

Name: Espana (SSC 3146)
Characteristics: hybrid Piel de Sapo type with improved uniformity and yield.

Name: Eureka (1201)
Characteristics: blocky oval shape, slightly ribbed, good netting, small seed cavity, thick orange flesh, maturity like Planters Jumbo.
Similar: Seminole and Edisto but smaller seed cavity, also Imperial No. 45 and King Henry. 1974.
Resistance: tolerance to powdery mildew races 1 and 2.

Name: Explorer (NVH 881)
Characteristics: round oval fruit with well netted sutures; firm, sweet, bright-colored flesh; mid-season maturity, shipper type.

Name: Fanfair (XPH 6117)
Characteristics: typical muskmelon fruit in general appearance, but distinctly round with ribs and sparse netting.

Name: Fantasma (HMS 4595)
Characteristics: early maturity.
Resistance: fusarium wilt races 0, 2; powdery mildew race 1.

Name: Fastbreak (PSX 103390)
Characteristics: very early maturing, large fruited, high quality muskmelon for eastern U.S. markets and home gardening. Has corky net and deep sutures.

Name: Fiola (Nun 7009)
Characteristics: Vauclusien type cantaloupe with long shelf life; netted Fiata type, oval shape, netted sutures, orange flesh with high sugar content, medium early, average fruit wt. 1.4-1.6 kg.

Name: Floridew (Florida Honeydew 1)
Characteristics: uniform fruit size, smaller than most honeydews; high sugars and productivity.

Name: Florigold (Fla. 1)
Characteristics: large fruit, high sugars, well netted, no ridges.
Adaptation: Florida and southeastern United States. Fla. Agr. Sta. Circ. S-139. 1962.

Name: Florisun (Fla. 8)
Characteristics: large fruit, good sugars, well netted, ridged.
Adaptation: southeastern United States. Fla. Agr. Sta. Circ. S-139. 1962.

Name: Fordhook Gem
Characteristics: open pollinated, prolific, well netted, green-fleshed melon, delicate sweet flavor.
Parentage: Extra Early Knight x Netted Gem.

Name: Fore Runner (SSC 3109)
Characteristics: large, early maturing cantaloupe with a strong vine cover, tight seed cavity, and high productivity.

Name: Galexcia (XPH 6018)
Characteristics: fruit slightly netted, oval round, weighs approximately 1.5 kg, flesh light green, aromatic and sweet.

Name: Galleon (XPH 5363)
Characteristics: early maturity, round fruit, western shipper cantaloupe with high quality and yield.

Name: Gallery (001 258)
Characteristics: 74-76 day maturity, 2.0-2.5 lb. fruit, sweet flesh, flavorful, light green, netted, round, productive vines, strong plant.

Name: Galo (XPH 5183)
Characteristics: early maturity, high quality melon, good for shipping to distant markets, holds well during shipping.

Name: Georgia 47
Characteristics: round, netted, faint ribs, average size, slightly below 36, flesh deep salmon, good, has navel at blossom end of 5% to 10% of melons.
Adaptation: areas where downy mildew is a limiting factor. Southern Seedsman 14(11):31. November, 1951.
Resistance: highly to downy mildew, medium to powdery, and some to aphids.
Parentage: Hearts of Gold x 29554 (Whitaker selection from PI 124112); a fifth generation selection from this cross was crossed with Smith's Perfect.

Name: Gold 264 (PS 03792264)
Characteristics: strong, very vigorous and dark green plant with high and cncentrated fruit setting; plant stays green even when fruits are becoming mature; very early maturity, uniform oval/round shape, bright yellow color and slightly rough skin; fruit size varies between 1.24 to 1.45 kg.
Similar: AF 646, Rochedo, Gold Pride, Gold Mine.

Name: Gold Cup
Characteristics: vigorous vines; heavy production; good flesh color; good quality.
Adaptation: western coast of United States, Arizona, Mexico, and Texas. 1957.

Name: Gold Cup 55 (no. 55)
Characteristics: large plants with good spread; solid, heavy net with minimum ribbing.
Adaptation: California, Arizona, and Texas. Ferry-Morse, 15 April, 1963.

Name: Gold Eagle (HMX 1601)
Characteristics: high yield and wide adaptability.
Resistance: fusarium wilt races 0, 2; downy mildew, powdery mildew, tolerant to PRSV.

Name: Gold Master (SHP)
Characteristics: productivity and uniformity.

Name: Gold Mine (HMX 9584)
Characteristics: very high quality with medium sized fruit, very strong net with excellent shipping characteristics.

Name: Gold Pride (PS20594)
Characteristics: vigorous plant, good cover, high sugar content, productive, good storage life, good taste, good outside color, yellow melon.

Name: Gold Rush (HMX 9583)
Characteristics: concentrated set, wide adaptability, very early maturity, western fullnet type cantaloupe.

Name: Gold Star (CA22)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, fruit early, prolific, medium size, oval, heavy netted, ribbed.

Name: Gold Street (PS19894)
Characteristics: yellow melon, vigorous plant, good cover, high sugar content, very productive, good taste.

Name: Goldbeatre (PSX 001137)
Characteristics: full-net shipper oval fruit shape, coarse net, firm flesh, uniform sizes, deep salmon flesh color, excellent flavor, does well under eastern U.S. humid conditions.
Resistance: powdery mildew race 1, fusarium wilt race 2.

Name: Golden Crenshaw
Breeder: Local cultivar introduced by California Agric. Expt. Sta., Davis.
Vendor: Local cultivar introduced by California Agric. Expt. Sta., Davis.
Characteristics: oblong shape, pointed stem end, uneven color change at maturity.

Name: Golden Delight
Characteristics: early, large fruited, thick, orange flesh; sweet and fragrant.

Name: Golden Gate 45
Characteristics: large, spreading plants; excellent quality; good shipper; solid net with practically no green sutures.
Adaptation: California, Arizona, and Texas. Ferry-Morse 15 April, 1963.

Name: Golden Gopher
Parentage: not definitely known; thought to be Benders Surprise x Honeydew.

Name: Golden Harvest (Hyb 30516)
Characteristics: very high disease resistance, fresh market melon.

Name: Golden Pershaw
Characteristics: external netting like Persian, color like Honey Dew, flesh resembles Crenshaw.

Name: Golden Pride (Hyb 30436)
Characteristics: disease resistant.

Name: Golden Shipper (H-22515)
Characteristics: early shipping muskmelon.

Name: Goldmark (Sunex 7013)
Characteristics: disease resistance, large-fruited shipping cantaloupe.

Name: Gran Dew (Prod#0137)
Characteristics: honeydew, main season, maturity, high fruit set, very smooth, size 6-8 lb fruit, light seed cavity, no netting, round to oval.

Name: Grande Gold (102-5)
Characteristics: high yield and disease resistance.

Name: Granite State
Characteristics: early, high quality.

Name: Guerrero (SME 7122)
Characteristics: western shipper type cantaloupe.

Name: Gulfstream (63-4)
Breeder: U.S. Veg. Breeding Lab., Charleston, South Carolina.
Characteristics: Round Hale's type.
Resistance: field resistant to downy and powdery mildews.

Name: Gurney (4273)
Characteristics: homegarden muskmelon, large fruited.

Name: Gusto 45 (XP 750)
Characteristics: resembles 45 SJ in fruit type, but earlier, more vigorous vine.
Adaptation: long season areas of the far western and southwestern United States. 1972.
Resistance: two strains of powdery mildew; tolerance to one form of crown blight.

Name: Haley (SSC 114)
Characteristics: honeydew type; broad adaptation; strong vines produce fruit in the 4s, 5s and 6s size range; fruit has smooth rind, rounded shape and small to medium seed cavity; compares to Samantha but 3 to 5 days earlier in maturity.

Name: Harper Hybrid
Breeder: Canada Dept. of Agr. Expt. Farm, Harrow, Ont., Canada.
Characteristics: round, no ribs, well covered with fine netting, thick flesh, high quality; ships well.
Adaptation: wide. L.F. Ounsworth, Canada Dept. of Agr., 1958. 1955.
Parentage: fusarium Resistant Green Fleshed x Susceptible Early, High Quality.

Name: Harvest Queen
Breeder: Joseph Harris Company, Rochester, New York.
Vendor: Joseph Harris Company, Rochester, New York.
Characteristics: fusarium resistant, Market King (Queen of Colorado) type, hard rind, good shipping.

Name: Healy's Pride
Characteristics: large size, 10-15 pound, oblong shape, not turbinate, medium firm shell, high flesh quality.
Parentage: (Banana x Condon's Perfection) Pride of Wisconsin) Pride of Wisconsin.

Name: Heart O'Gold (NVH 887)
Characteristics: short oval to round melon with high sugar levels with a heavy net covering medium sutures.

Name: Herculis (KXPM-179)
Characteristics: large, very well netted western-shipper cantaloupe; dark orange and firm flesh with high solids; produces very vigorous and dark green vines; excellent shipper; monoecious.
Adaptation: all areas where size is a problem (winter, late fall). 1996.
Resistance: powdery mildew race 1; tolerance to race 2; fusarium race 2.

Name: Hiline (XPH 914)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, early western shipper with medium to heavy netting; nearly round in shape; relatively small cavity; highly productive and uniform.

Name: HM 5581 (HMX 5581)
Characteristics: monoecious, oval, sutured.

Name: HM 6593 (HMX 6593)
Characteristics: very early maturity, northeastern adaptation, eastern type muskmelon.

Name: Homegarden
Breeder: S.S. Ivanoff, Mississippi Agric. Expt. Sta., State College.
Characteristics: high sugar content; distinctive flavor.
Resistance: moderate to downy and powdery mildew; high to aphids. Miss. Farm Res., vol. 19. p. 1. January, 1956. Southern Seedsman, vol. 19, April, 1956.
Parentage: inbred selection Smith's Perfect x Col. PMR 5.

Name: Honey Ball No. 306
Breeder: University of California, Davis, California and the Hort. Field Sta., USDA, La Jolla, California.
Characteristics: small seed cavity, orange-colored flesh.
Similar: Melo Gold. University of California Circ. 352. 1942.
Resistance: all known races of powdery mildew.

Name: Honey Bun
Characteristics: cantaloupe.

Name: Honey Chow (137)
Characteristics: honeydew, main-season, high fruit set, very smooth, tight seed cavity, oval size fruit, no netting, very smooth skin.

Name: Honey Gold (HMX 7603)
Characteristics: very uniform size, excellent quality and shipping ability, hybrid orange flesh honeydew.

Name: Honey King (NVH 975)
Characteristics: green flesh honeydew type, very smooth, does not produce netting except under stress conditions. oval fruit shape 8 x 7'; uniform for shape and size, excellent long distance shipper, matures in 90 days, excellent quality.

Name: Honey Moon
Characteristics: good disease resistance.

Name: Honey Pac (XP6403)
Characteristics: oval/round, green flesh honeydew, small seed cavity, high brix, early maturity.

Name: Honey Rock, FR
Vendor: Joseph Harris Company, Rochester, New York.
Characteristics: early medium sized oval melon with heavy net; ribbed yellow flesh.
Adaptation: northeastern United States and southern Canada. Harris catalog, 1955.
Parentage: Michigan grower selection from fusarium resistant lines obtained from Michigan State University.

Name: Honey Star (Sunex 7037)
Characteristics: disease resistant, large, sweet honeydew.

Name: Honeybush
Characteristics: short internode bush type plants, bearing 3-6 melons ranging in size from 2.5-3 lb, very thick juicy orange flesh with small seed cavity.

Name: Honeycream (PSX 5086)
Characteristics: large uniform fruit; almost round fruit; rind color is almost creamy white at maturity.

Name: Honeygold
Characteristics: green slip melon coming from vine on full slip several days before ready to eat.
Parentage: Hearts of Gold, Honey Dew, and Vegetable Peach or Mango; a distinct cultivar.

Name: Honeyshaw (PS 1576)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, medium size, skin ribbed, dark green to yellow at maturity, flesh pastel pink to orange, sweet, distinctive flavor, early with yellow-green speckles; vine vigorous.
Adaptation: sunbelt and possibly to home garden use in the midwestern and eastern United States. 1980.

Name: Hybrid Persian (SSC 30204)
Characteristics: Persian type melon with an 80-85 day maturity; fruit is oval-round; slips at maturity.

Name: Hy-Mark (PSX S781)
Characteristics: 83 days, western shipper; oval, 5 x 5.5', 3-3.5 lb, full medium net, no sutures, deep salmon flesh.

Name: Intrepid (NVH 880)
Characteristics: produces no sutures, fully netted and excellent interior quality; matures in Shipmaster and Tam Uvalde season; fruit are 45-36 size, slightly oval, a long distance shipper type.
Resistance: powdery mildew race 1, low resistance to downy mildew.

Name: Isabella (PS 152140)
Characteristics: netted type with sutures; Charentais flavor, taste and flesh; good shelf life with good holding ability in field; fruit size is approximately 1 to 1.5 kg, depending on growing area and conditions.

Name: Ironhorse (Sunex 7043)
Characteristics: very disease and aphid resistant.
Resistance: fusarium wilt, powdery mildew, downy mildew, aphids. 1993.

Name: Iroquois
Characteristics: round to slightly oval fruit, thick, high quality, orange flesh; similar in size to smaller strains of Benders.
Adaptation: regionally, northeastern and midwestern United States and eastern Canada. Farm Res. 10(2):20. 1944.

Name: Jacumba (LJ43724-M4, PMR 21)
Breeder: USDA, LaJolla, California., University of California, and University of Arizona.
Characteristics: vigorous, early, fruit extra firm for shipping.
Resistance: powdery mildew; tolerance to crown blight.
Parentage: (LJ36486 x PMR 45) x PMR 450 x PMR 450 x PMR 450.

Name: Jewel (189-13-6)
Characteristics: hybrid, Early Hale's Best type, uniform good quality, firm salmon flesh, slightly oval shape, medium coarse net, slightly ribbed.

Name: Juno (XP 764)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, large, slightly elongated fruit.
Resistance: tolerance to one or more races of powdery mildew.

Name: King Henry
Characteristics: shipping type selected for fine net and indistinct ribbing or furrowing.

Name: Laguna (XPH 5014)
Characteristics: very early, season opener for Texas and southwest desert areas of U.S.; up to 10 days earlier than Topmark, large sutureless fruit with heavy crown set, small cavity, excellent shipper.

Name: Laredo (PSX 30787)
Characteristics: large, full-netted fruit, firm flesh, early, western shipper type.

Name: Legacy (SSC 77)
Characteristics: strong vine cover, fully netted round western shipper type.

Name: Legend (XPH 5362)
Characteristics: a sutured, round-oblong melon weighing approximately 6-7 lb, orange flesh with small seed cavity.

Name: Limelight
Characteristics: two weeks earlier than Honeydew; slips from vine when ripe; thick, pale green flesh; very prolific.

Name: Lobo (KXPM-212)
Characteristics: round mid-size sutureless shipping type cantaloupe, dark green foliage, very good yield; small and tight seed cavity, high sugar and firm flesh.
Resistance: powdery mildew race 1, tolerance race 2, fusarium wilt race 2.

Name: Longkeeper
Characteristics: cantaloupe type.

Name: Luscious
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, medium-early, regular vine size, thick netting with pronounced sutures; fruit are slightly oval, 4-6 pounds, salmon color flesh, and slightly musky flavor.

Name: Madras (XP 4047)
Characteristics: fruit are large and uniform, 3-4 days earlier than Amarillo Oro.

Name: Magellan (PX6246)
Characteristics: western shipper, round, ropey, sutureless, even netted; flesh is thick, crisp and bright orange.

Name: Magno (HMX 6583)
Characteristics: western shipping cantaloupe; early maturing; large fruit, round, full-netted.

Name: Magnum 45 (PSX 5077)
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, fruit well netted, lightly sutured, 6 x 5', flesh deep orange; small seed cavity, early and concentrated set.

Name: Mainpak (7018)
Characteristics: uniform, high-yielding, disease resistant.

Name: Mainstream (63-4-M1-18-M8)
Breeder: U.S. Veg. Laboratory, USDA, Charleston, South Carolina.
Characteristics: open pollinated, high yield, small compact plant, high ascorbic acid (vitamin C); orange colored flesh.
Adaptation: southeast United States, Indiana, and California. 1978.
Resistance: powdery mildew, downy mildew, and cucumber beetles.

Name: Marathon (NV 900)
Characteristics: long distance shipper, normal vine, fruit size 36-45; slightly oval, well netted with little or no suturing, thick flesh, small seed cavity.

Name: Marco Polo (XPH 6112)
Characteristics: very early western shipper cantaloupe.

Name: Mel-O-Dew
Breeder: Burgess Seed and Plant Company, Galesburg, Michigan.
Vendor: Burgess Seed and Plant Company, Galesburg, Michigan.
Characteristics: thick fleshed, good netting, Honey Dew flavor, earlier than Honey Dew.
Adaptation: wide. Burgess Seed and Plant Company. Cat. 1940.
Parentage: possibly field cross Hale's Best and Honey Dew.

Name: Meloso (XPH 5097)

Name: Millennium (KXPM-356)
Characteristics: large fruit, very smooth, small seed cavity; it produces very strong and vigorous vines; very good crown set; sweet with high solids.
Similar: Morning Ice and Crv®me de Menthe.
Adaptation: all honeydew areas where viruses are a problem and where size is needed.
Resistance: fusarium wilt race 2 and powdery mildew race 1; tolerance to CMV and WMV.

Name: Minn Honey
Breeder: University of Minnesota and Farmer Seed and Nursery Company, Faribault, Minn.
Characteristics: thick flesh, high sugar and yield 8-10 pound fruit.

Name: Morning Ray (HMX 6594)

Name: Musketeer (2503)

Name: NC-Sapphire (NC-303 x NC-309 F1)
Breeder: T.C. Wehner, T.L. Ellington, J.R. Schultheis, and W.R. Jester.
Characteristics: hybrid with andromonoecious flowering habit; indeterminate plant type, vines with palmate leaves having serrated margin, moderate fruit yield, early maturity; round or oval fruit shape, smooth white rind, crisp flesh texture, white flesh color, high sugar content, small seed cavity, freedom from defects; vines have typical palmate leaves with serrated margins. The fruit are uniform, with large size and elongate shape, and a tough and thin rind. Fruit have a length; diameter ratio of 1.2, a brix of 12, and weight of 0.8 kg; the fruit develop brown cracks that occur radially around the blossom scar at fruit maturity; radial cracks are an indicator of maturity.
Parentage: F1 hybrid of NC-303 x NC-309 inbreds, which were developed from the intercross of Sprite F1.

Name: NC-Sparta (NC-301 x NC-304 F1)
Breeder: T.C. Wehner, T.L. Ellington, J.R. Schultheis, and W.R. Jester.
Characteristics: hybrid with andromonoecious flowering habit; indeterminate plant type, vines with palmate leaves having serrated margin, moderate fruit yield, early maturity; round or oval fruit shape, smooth white rind, crisp flesh texture, white flesh color, high sugar content, small seed cavity, freedom from defects; vines have typical palmate leaves with serrated margins. The fruit are uniform, with medium size and elongate shape, and a tough and thin rind. Fruit have a length; diameter ratio of 1.2, a brix of 12, and weight of 0.7 kg; the fruit develop brown cracks that occur radially around the blossom scar at fruit maturity; radial cracks are an indicator of maturity.
Parentage: F1 hybrid of NC-301 x NC-304 inbreds, which were developed from the intercross of Sprite F1.

Name: NC-Star (NC-302 x NC-305 F1)
Breeder: T.C. Wehner, T.L. Ellington, J.R. Schultheis, and W.R. Jester.
Characteristics: hybrid with andromonoecious flowering habit; indeterminate plant type, vines with palmate leaves having serrated margin, moderate fruit yield, early maturity; round or oval fruit shape, smooth white rind, crisp flesh texture, white flesh color, high sugar content, small seed cavity, freedom from defects; vines have typical palmate leaves with serrated margins. The fruit are uniform, with small size and elongate shape, and a tough and thin rind. Fruit have a length; diameter ratio of 1.2, a brix of 13, and weight of 0.6 kg; the fruit develop brown cracks that occur radially around the blossom scar at fruit maturity; radial cracks are an indicator of maturity.
Parentage: F1 hybrid of NC-302 x NC-305 inbreds, which were developed from the intercross of Sprite F1.

Name: NC-Stella (NC-302 x NC-306 F1)
Breeder: T.C. Wehner, T.L. Ellington, J.R. Schultheis, and W.R. Jester.
Characteristics: hybrid with andromonoecious flowering habit; indeterminate plant type, vines with palmate leaves having serrated margin, moderate fruit yield, early maturity; round or oval fruit shape, smooth white rind, crisp flesh texture, white flesh color, high sugar content, small seed cavity, freedom from defects; vines have typical palmate leaves with serrated margins. The fruit are uniform, with small size and round shape, and a tough and thin rind. Fruit have a length; diameter ratio of 1.1, a brix of 13, and weight of 0.6 kg; the fruit develop brown cracks that occur radially around the blossom scar at fruit maturity; radial cracks are an indicator of maturity.
Parentage: F1 hybrid of NC-302 x NC-306 inbreds, which were developed from the intercross of Sprite F1.
